title: Iraq will take back Ramadi 'in days'
desc: Iraq's Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi says that the city of Ramadi could be taken back from Islamic State militants in days.

title: No referendum vote for EU citizens
desc: EU citizens living in the UK will not be eligible to vote in the in/out referendum on Europe except those from Ireland Malta and Gibraltar the government says.

title: IS threat to rare bird near Palmyra
desc: A rare bird may become extinct in Syria because of the capture of Palmyra by Islamic State experts say.

title: Malaysia finds 139 'migrant graves'
desc: A total of 139 grave sites of suspected migrants have been found in 28 trafficking camps close to Malaysia's border with Thailand police say.

title: Israel ex-PM given prison sentence
desc: The former Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert is sentenced to eight months in prison in a corruption trial.

title: Spanish protest parties make gains
desc: Protest parties make gains in Spain's local elections depriving the governing People's Party of overall control of Madrid and other councils.

title: Polish president concedes election
desc: Polish President Bronislaw Komorowski concedes the election to challenger Andrzej Duda after exit polls suggest he has lost the run-off vote.

title: Rain deluge hits southern US states
desc: A deluge of rainfall bursts rivers and brings flood warnings to several southern US states with Texas and Oklahoma the worst hit so far.

title: Details emerge about Sydney gunman
desc: Details about the isolated life lead by gunman Man Haron Monis emerge from an inquest into last December's siege at the Lindt cafe in Sydney.

title: Australian jailed for raping tourist
desc: An Australian man who imprisoned a Dutch backpacker in a hotel room for six weeks repeatedly raping and beating her is jailed for 17 years.

title: 'Beautiful Mind' mathematician killed
desc: Renowned mathematician John Nash subject of the film A Beautiful Mind dies in a New Jersey taxi crash with his wife.

title: VIDEO: Iraqi PM: Ramadi recapture 'in days'
desc: Iraq's Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi said Mr Carter's comments were misinformed and that Iraqi forces were just days away from recapturing Ramadi.

title: VIDEO: Anti-austerity votes shake Spain
desc: The governing People's Party in Spain has suffered heavy losses in regional and local elections.

title: VIDEO: Migrant's story of four months at sea
desc: Kasuma Hatu a Rohingya Muslim refugee from Myanmar describes her journey at sea from Myanmar to Langsa city in Indonesia.

title: VIDEO: First look in Japan's Sendai nuclear plant
desc: Four years after the worst nuclear disaster since Chernobyl Japan is about to return to using nuclear power.

title: VIDEO: Solar plane pilot set for six-day leg
desc: The first round-the-world solar-powered flight known as the Solar Impulse Two is hoping to make the next and most difficult leg of its journey.

title: VIDEO: US floods 'largest in region's history'
desc: A deluge of rainfall has burst rivers and brought flood warnings to several southern US states with Texas and Oklahoma the worst hit so far.

title: VIDEO: Is Modi still India's cup of tea?
desc: BBC News visited some tea stalls around Mumbai and asked ordinary Indians to rate Narendra Modi's first year in office.

title: VIDEO: Female activists cross Koreas' DMZ
desc: A group of female activists have made a rare crossing through one of the world's most militarised borders to promote reconciliation between North and South Korea.

title: Has Narendra Modi lived up to expectations?
desc: Narendra Modi's first year in power has been a mixed bag of hits and misses amid concerns over rising social tensions writes Soutik Biswas.

title: Is the UK still a Christian country?
desc: With number of people calling themselves Christian in the UK in decline is religion in crisis?

title: The shadowy centre helping former al-Shabab members quit
desc: In Somalia a disengagement programme has been set up for surrendering al-Shabab members. Andrew Harding took a look.

title: Nash's ground-breaking ideas
desc: John Nash the US mathematician who has died aged 86 made an enduring contribution to his field writes maths lecturer John Moriarty.

title: Who are Israelâ€™s Ethiopian Jews?
desc: Protests over the beating of an Ethiopian Israeli soldier have thrown the spotlight on the Ethiopian Jewish community in Israel writes Prof Yossi Mekelberg.

title: Can California learn to live with drought?
desc: Californians are facing their fourth year of severe drought - can they adapt to find a way forward?

title: Japan shares at 15-year high on data
desc: Japanese shares close at a 15-year high after data showed the country's trade account fell into a deficit in April but was still better than expected.

title: Greece 'cannot afford IMF repayment'
desc: Greece will not be able to make a debt repayment to the IMF due in early June as it does not have the money the interior minister says.

title: Google patents 'creepy' cuddly toys
desc: A patent reveals that Google has looked into making internet-connected toys that would link up to its servers to control smart devices in the home.

title: Starbucks gift card hack was 'fraud'
desc: A hacker reporting a security hole in Starbucks' website criticises the company's handling of the matter.

title: French film Dheepan wins at Cannes
desc: French director Jacques Audiard's film Dheepan wins the top prize at Cannes the Palme d'Or.

title: Sweden scoops Eurovision 2015 crown
desc: Swedish singer Mans Zelmerlow triumphs at this year's Eurovision Song Contest in Vienna beating Russia's Polina Gagarina.

title: Spiders strum on leaves for love
desc: Purring spiders use leaves as microphones and speakers to transmit their purring courtship song to a female scientists find.

title: Ocean's 'tiniest organisms' revealed
desc: Thousands of species of the ocean's tiniest organisms are revealed in a series of studies.

title: Depression makes heart failure worse
desc: People with heart failure must be screened for signs of depression and offered counselling scientists say.

title: Quarter of skin cells 'on road to cancer'
desc: More than a quarter of a middle-aged person's skin may have already made the first steps towards cancer a study suggests.

title: I'll go if owners want - Rodgers
desc: Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers accepts his future is in doubt after his side's 6-1 thrashing at Stoke City.

title: Mercedes apologise to Hamilton
desc: Mercedes apologise to Lewis Hamilton for what they admitted was the strategic error that cost him victory in Monaco.

title: Europe's next cheap holiday destination?
desc: As no-frills airlines start flying to the Azores Simon Calder asks whether the islands in the Atlantic Ocean could become the next big holiday destination.

title: Saving coffee from extinction
desc: Two billion cups of coffee are drunk around the world every day but scientists says the most popular species Arabica is under threat - they are now working to save it from extinction.

title: Gary Barlow sings at final wedding
desc: A bride who booked a Gary Barlow lookalike for her wedding gets a shock as the real Take That star turns up to sing.

title: VIDEO: Millie gets pick of bespoke doghouses
desc: Interior design students at a Leicester university create a series of doghouses as part of a 'Barkitechture' project.

title: Ethiopians in first post-Meles vote
desc: Ethiopians vote in the first elections since the 2012 death of Prime Minister Meles Zenawi with predictions his successor will retain power.

title: Mumbai Indians claim 2015 IPL title
desc: Mumbai Indians win the Indian Premier League title after beating Chennai Super Kings in the final in Kolkata.

title: Irish Church needs 'reality check'
desc: One of Ireland's most senior Catholic clerics calls for the Church to take a reality check following the country's overwhelming vote in favour of same-sex marriage.

title: Venezuela's Lopez on hunger strike
desc: Jailed Venezuelan opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez announces on a leaked video he has gone on hunger strike demanding freedom for political prisoners.

title: 'Israel row' sinks UN nuclear talks
desc: A UN conference aimed at preventing the proliferation of nuclear weapons ends in failure after a row over a nuclear-free Middle East proposal.

title: US Senate blocks surveillance bill
desc: The US Senate blocks a bill that would have extended bulk collection of phone records by the National Security Agency.

title: Hunt for stab deaths suspect goes on
desc: The hunt for a man suspected of killing his six-year-old sister his mother and her partner in Oxfordshire enters its second day.

title: Search for missing diver suspended
desc: A major search of the English Channel for a diver who failed to resurface during a trip is suspended for the night.

title: Dyslexia 'not linked to eyesight'
desc: There are no differences in the eyesight of dyslexics and non-dyslexics say researchers

title: Hull City 0-0 Manchester United
desc: Hull City are relegated from the Premier League as they fail to beat Manchester United and Newcastle win their final game.
